attributes.action: Increase the penalty for using a mobile phone behind the wheel to include a ban
attributes.additional_details: I wear a camera. I have submitted footage to Lancashire Police only to be told it isn't in the public interest to prosecute, as the Police are far too busy. This is even when I have supplied HD footage showing mobile phone use whilst driving.
attributes.background: I commute to work by cycle, as it is better for the environment, keeps me fit and helps to cut congestion. I also cycle between 60-100 miles each Sunday for enjoyment. However, I have had numerous near misses by motorists using their mobile phones whilst driving.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The courts can already impose a driving or riding ban for driving or riding while using a hand-held telephone, so we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. You can find out more about the penalties available here:

https://www.gov.uk/using-mobile-phones-when-driving-the-law

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You might like to sign this petition, which calls for a minimum 6 month driving ban for mobile phone use whilst driving:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/240006
